issue.title: [C++] cmake can't use conda's flatbuffers
issue.body:

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793157) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think this might be a dup of ARROW-4878 (because of ARROW_PREFIX_PATH being set wrong)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793162) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Can you show the whole `cmake` command you are using?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793182) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
The cmake files are in the tarball:

```Java

$ tar xvf flatbuffers-1.10.0-hf484d3e_1002.tar.bz2 
info/hash_input.json
info/index.json
info/files
info/about.json
info/paths.json
info/git
info/recipe/conda_build_config.yaml
info/recipe/meta.yaml
info/test/run_test.sh
info/recipe/build.sh
lib/libflatbuffers.a
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatbuffersConfig.cmake
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatbuffersConfigVersion.cmake
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatcTargets-release.cmake
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatbuffersTargets-release.cmake
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatcTargets.cmake
lib/cmake/flatbuffers/FlatbuffersTargets.cmake
include/flatbuffers/flatc.h
include/flatbuffers/hash.h
include/flatbuffers/code_generators.h
include/flatbuffers/registry.h
include/flatbuffers/stl_emulation.h
include/flatbuffers/base.h
include/flatbuffers/grpc.h
include/flatbuffers/minireflect.h
include/flatbuffers/util.h
include/flatbuffers/reflection.h
include/flatbuffers/idl.h
include/flatbuffers/reflection_generated.h
include/flatbuffers/flexbuffers.h
include/flatbuffers/flatbuffers.h
info/recipe/meta.yaml.template
info/recipe/bld.bat
bin/flatc
```

It seems that in older conda packages the files were in `lib64/cmake` so that might be fouling things up

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793185) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
OK, I think you only need to install the newest Flatbuffers conda package. This was fixed about 3 weeks ago, I believe in response to the CMake refactor patch

https://github.com/conda-forge/flatbuffers-feedstock/commit/3acd4aec0f8e845f4a5c99203b58d8dc4a4b1004#diff-44a73bcc045c193c3bd45da87994b03b

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793189) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
I updated the conda package earlier today (`conda update flatbuffers`), still getting the error.

`$CONDA_PREFIX/lib/cmake/flatbuffers` doesn't exist, and `grep cmake /home/bkietz/miniconda3/envs/pyarrow-dev/conda-meta/flatbuffers-1.7.1-hf484d3e_0.json` is empty.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793192) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
Ah, found it: for some reason flatbuffers had installed from the anaconda channel rather than conda-forge. Removing and reinstalling from conda-forge fixes this for me. Should I add this to doc anywhere?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793210) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I think we have `-c conda-forge` everywhere in our docs. I'm about to do a pass over our build docs so do have a look

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793475) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Opened an issue with Anaconda: https://github.com/ContinuumIO/anaconda-issues/issues/10731

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793476) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
Also opened https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4888 so that we test building with defaults.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793612) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I hit this problem on one of my other machines and resolve it by updating to the most recent Flatbuffers conda-forge package

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4879?focusedCommentId=16793621) by Ben Kietzman (bkietz):*
Alright, I guess this is general conda knowledge I didn't have: creating a conda environment with a channel specified doesn't set default channel. For that, use `conda config --add channels conda-forge`
